There's no RNG in aram. It always tries to force you into playing certain champions periodically.

I wrote a detailed explanation of how ARAM's champ RNG works last year on the old boards. Here's a link and I'll repaste the main section below. But yeah, sometimes true RNG feels like it has a mind of its own. o.O

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=49448041#49448041

> ARAM's RNG is truly random from within the champions you have available at champ select.
> 
> I'll elaborate a little here. ARAM's RNG is truly random from the champions you own + the free weekly rotation champs. There is no weighting on any groups or champs whatsoever. When using a reroll, you obviously can't reroll a champ that someone on your team already has, so the system randoms again from your remaining pool (you are also guaranteed to not reroll the exact same champion again, so your pool is technically n-1). Rerolled champs go back into the available pool for everyone else to random if they use any subsequent rerolls.

As much as I love ARAM, it really sucks when you get the short end of the straw. Having a melee team against a ranged one, or just one with a lot of poke ends up boiling down to a lost game.  Wouldn't it be a bit more progressive for the randomness in ARAM to be a little bit calculated? So that one team has a high champ favour than the other? It sounds like it would fix some issues, while not taking anything away from the gameplay. I don't know. What do you guys think?

I dunno, I've won several aram games with melee teams against all ranged teams. It's really all about figuring out when to fight and when not to fight, but poke comps are a lot easier to play correctly. (Dodging helps too)

You can't always lose. To me and I'm certain other people believe it too, there shouldn't be a problem with evening out a playing field. Having games go 70/30 because of random comps just makes it a waste of 20 minutes.
